meanings.definition: Consisting of or using a single wire or filament.
meanings.sent1: The unifilar antenna was perfect for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The unifilar cable provided a reliable connection.
meanings.sent3: The unifilar wire decided to go solo and not join the bundle.
meanings.sent4: Her unifilar approach to problem-solving stood out among the team.
meanings.sent5: The unifilar design of the circuit simplified the connections.

meanings.definition: Having only one thread or wire.
meanings.sent1: He carefully sewed the unifilar thread through the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The unifilar string held the beads together securely.
meanings.sent3: The unifilar yarn refused to be tangled with others in the basket.
meanings.sent4: The unifilar rope was strong enough to support the weight.
meanings.sent5: The unifilar strand of hair stood out among the rest.

meanings.definition: Involving or using a single line or strand.
meanings.sent1: The unifilar path through the maze was straightforward.
meanings.sent2: The unifilar design of the bridge was elegant in its simplicity.
meanings.sent3: The unifilar route on the map seemed like a shortcut.
meanings.sent4: Her unifilar explanation made the concept easy to understand.
meanings.sent5: The unifilar pattern on the fabric was visually appealing.
